title: IN FLAMES Splits With Drummer TANNER WAYNE
description: A "creative decision," according to In Flames. The post IN FLAMES Splits With Drummer TANNER WAYNE appeared first on Metal Injection.
author: Greg Kennelty
byline: By Greg Kennelty Published 6 hours ago
excerpt: A "creative decision," according to In Flames.
text: In Flames has parted ways with drummer Tanner Wayne, who joined the band back in 2018. In Flames has issued a statement saying they're carrying on with all their planned live dates (which you can find below), but hasn't mentioned who will be drumming for them. Wayne has also not commented on either splitting or being fired from In Flames. "It is with profound gratitude and appreciation that we announce our creative decision to part ways with Tanner Wayne," wrote In Flames. "His dedication and musicianship over the past several years has left, and will continue to leave, a lasting mark on this band. We wish him nothing but the best. We appreciate your support and understanding at this time and hope to see you all on tour this summer." In Flames' live dates for this summer are as follows. 6/2 Tallinn, Estonia Noblessneri Valukoda (w/ Jinjer, Unprocessed)6/3 Vilnius, Lithuania Compensa Concert Hall (w/ Jinjer, Unprocessed)6/4–6/7 Gdańsk, Poland Mystic Festival 20256/6–6/8 Nürburg, Germany Rock am Ring 20256/6–6/8 Nürnberg, Germany Rock im Park 20256/7–6/8 Maastricht, Netherlands South of Heaven Open Air 20256/10 Ljubljana, Slovenia Ljubljana (w/ Heaven Shall Burn, Jinjer, Paleface Swiss, Sylosis)6/11 Kufstein, Austria Kufstein Festung (w/ Heaven Shall Burn)6/12–6/15 Nickelsdorf, Austria Nova Rock 20256/13 Hradec Králové 7, Czechia Rock for People 20256/15 Lignano Sabbiadoro, Italy Arena Alpe Adria (w/ Lacuna Coil)6/17 Ramonville-St-Agne, France Le Bikini (w/ Orbit Culture)6/18–6/21 Copenhagen, Denmark Copenhell Festival 20256/18 Villeurbanne, France Transbordeur (w/ Orbit Culture)6/19–6/22 Dessel, Belgium Graspop Metal Meeting 20256/20 Leipzig, Germany Haus Auensee (w/ Orbit Culture, Sylosis)6/22 Dessel, Belgium Graspop Metal Meeting 2025 (w/ Heaven Shall Burn, Judas Priest, Till Lindemann)6/24 Reykjavik, Iceland Harpa6/26–6/29 Cartagena, Spain Rock Imperium Festival 20256/26–6/28 Seinäjoki, Finland Provinssi 20256/27–6/29 Helsinki, Finland Tuska Festival 20257/2 Motala, Sweden Motala Lokverkstad7/3 Docksta, Sweden Naturscen Skuleberget (w/ Imminence)7/3–7/5 Borlänge, Sweden Alive Festival Borlänge City 20257/5 Huskvarna, Sweden Folkets Park (w/ Imminence)7/7 Québec, Québec Festival d'été de Québec 2025 Want More Metal? html:
In Flames has parted ways with drummer Tanner Wayne, who joined the band back in 2018. In Flames has issued a statement saying they're carrying on with all their planned live dates (which you can find below), but hasn't mentioned who will be drumming for them. Wayne has also not commented on either splitting or being fired from In Flames.

"It is with profound gratitude and appreciation that we announce our creative decision to part ways with Tanner Wayne," wrote In Flames. "His dedication and musicianship over the past several years has left, and will continue to leave, a lasting mark on this band. We wish him nothing but the best. We appreciate your support and understanding at this time and hope to see you all on tour this summer."

In Flames' live dates for this summer are as follows.

6/2 Tallinn, Estonia Noblessneri Valukoda (w/ Jinjer, Unprocessed)
6/3 Vilnius, Lithuania Compensa Concert Hall (w/ Jinjer, Unprocessed)
6/4–6/7 Gdańsk, Poland Mystic Festival 2025
6/6–6/8 Nürburg, Germany Rock am Ring 2025
6/6–6/8 Nürnberg, Germany Rock im Park 2025
6/7–6/8 Maastricht, Netherlands South of Heaven Open Air 2025
6/10 Ljubljana, Slovenia Ljubljana (w/ Heaven Shall Burn, Jinjer, Paleface Swiss, Sylosis)
6/11 Kufstein, Austria Kufstein Festung (w/ Heaven Shall Burn)
6/12–6/15 Nickelsdorf, Austria Nova Rock 2025

6/18 Villeurbanne, France Transbordeur (w/ Orbit Culture)
6/19–6/22 Dessel, Belgium Graspop Metal Meeting 2025

6/22 Dessel, Belgium Graspop Metal Meeting 2025 (w/ Heaven Shall Burn, Judas Priest, Till Lindemann)
6/24 Reykjavik, Iceland Harpa
6/26–6/29 Cartagena, Spain Rock Imperium Festival 2025
6/26–6/28 Seinäjoki, Finland Provinssi 2025
6/27–6/29 Helsinki, Finland Tuska Festival 2025
7/2 Motala, Sweden Motala Lokverkstad
7/3 Docksta, Sweden Naturscen Skuleberget (w/ Imminence)
7/3–7/5 Borlänge, Sweden Alive Festival Borlänge City 2025
7/5 Huskvarna, Sweden Folkets Park (w/ Imminence)
7/7 Québec, Québec Festival d'été de Québec 2025
